title: Internal compiler error when building empty crate

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I initially saw this when building [unicode-xid](https://github.com/unicode-rs/unicode-xid) however, I have been able to reproduce it building a newly created, empty crate.

### Steps to reproduce

```
> cargo new --lib ice-test
     Created library `ice-test` package
> cd ice-test
> cargo +nightly build
```

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.57.0-nightly (5ecc8ad84 2021-09-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 5ecc8ad8462574354a55162a0c16b10eb95e3e70
commit-date: 2021-09-19
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.57.0-nightly
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

### Error output

```
   Compiling ice-test v0.1.0 (/Users/youngrob2/dev/github/robyoung/ice-test)
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: "Provided allocation has wrong size for slot count 131072"', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/decoder.rs:263:29
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.57.0-nightly (5ecc8ad84 2021-09-19) running on aarch64-apple-darwin

note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
end of query stack
error: could not compile `ice-test`
```
